Class HighScoreManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • HighScoreManager

  • public class HighScoreManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.1, May 11, 2014 The program, as the class name suggests, is the high score manager. This program is a dataclass that stores all the current high scores, including name and the corresponding score. There are a variety of methods within this manager that allows the high scores to be cleared, printed, checked for validity, added, accessed, and updated.

    Variable Dictionary
    Name Type Purpose
    list ArrayList This variable stores all the top players and their corresponding scores.

    Author:
    Daniel Chen

    • Constructor Detail

      • HighScoreManager

        public HighScoreManager()
        This is the class constructor. This constructor generates a new Arraylist of Scores and also checks if the Highscores.txt file exists or not. If the .txt file does not exist, then this constructor will generate one by calling the update method.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (new File... the purpose of this structure is to check if the Highscores.txt file exists or not.

      • print

        public boolean print()
        The purpose of this method is to allow print the high scores.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (list.size() > 0) The purpose of this structure is to check if there is actually something to be printed (instead of just a blank page).
        try{}catch(IOException... The purpose of this structure is to prevent the program from crashing when obtaining the menu and logo images.
        for (int i = 0... The purpose of this loop is to send in all data that is to be printed in a properly formatted way.

        Parameters:
        p - Gives method access to Printer methods and variables.
        e - Variable associated to the portion of code that prevents the code from crashing due to an IOException error.
        i - Variable used to help the for loop - acts as a loop counter.
        Returns:
        Returns whether or not the data was properly printed or not.

      • checkScore

        public boolean checkScore(int newScore)
        The purpose of this method is to check if the current player has beaten a high score or not.

        Loops and Variables
        if (list.size() < 10) The purpose of this structure is to check if the current list length is under 10 or not. for (int i = 0... The purpose of this loop is to compare the player's current score with the current high scores. (Only if the list currently has 10 stored high scores.)

        Returns:
        True if the player has made it into the high scores and false if the player has not.

      • read

        public boolean read()
        The purpose of this method is to read in all the currently stored high scores that have been saved to a .txt file.

        Loops and Conditions
        try {} catch (IO...) catch (Num...) The purpose of this structure is to prevent the program from crashing due to an IOException or a NumberFormatException error.
        for (int i = Integer.par... The purpose of this loop is to read in all the scores from the .txt file.

        Parameters:
        in - This variable allows the method to access the .txt file storing the scores.
        file - This variable is allows the method to single in on the .txt file containing the Highscores.
        i - This variable helps the for loop by acting as a loop counter.
        e - This variable is associated to the portion of code that prevents the program from crashing due to an IOException.
        e - This variable is associated to the portion of code that prevents the program from crashing due to a NumberFormatException.
        s - Score This variable gives the program access to the variables and methods of Score.
        Returns:
        Returns a true/false based on whether or not the program properly read in the data from the .txt file or not.

      • update

        public boolean update()
        The purpose of this method is to update the information in the .txt file.

        Loops and Conditions
        try{}catch(IOException... The purpose of this structure is to prevent the program from crashing due to an IOException.
        for (Score s: list) The purpose of this loop is to read in every single updated score into the .txt file.

        Parameters:
        out - This variable allows the method to write out the data to the correct .txt file.
        s - This variable allows the method to have access to the variables and methods of Score.
        e - This variable is associated to the portion of code that disallows the program to crash from an IOException.
        Returns:
        True/false based on whether or not the data could be written to the .txt file or not.
